messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5 to 35 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Target Temperature
      Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Humidity
      Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature
        Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Set Humidity Target [SET_HUM]
      Parameter 1: Humidity
        Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Humidity [REPORT_HUM]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22.5 degrees Celsius and switch the mode to heat?

First, I review the device structure to identify the commands and parameters needed. The thermostat accepts a Set Target Temperature command with a temperature parameter ranging from 10 to 30 °C in 0.5 increments, so 22.5 °C is valid. It also accepts a Set Mode command with modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto; Heat corresponds to enum value 1.

To fulfill the request, I will:
1. Use the Set Target Temperature command with parameter 22.5 °C.
2. Use the Set Mode command with parameter Heat (1).

Result: Execute SET_TEMP with 22.5 °C and SET_MODE with Heat to set the thermostat accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5 to 35 Unit Celsius (step of 0.1 and precision of 1).
    Target Temperature
      Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Humidity
      Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [SET_TEMP]
      Parameter 1: Temperature
        Range 10 to 30 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Set Mode [SET_MODE]
      Parameter 1: Mode
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SET_FAN]
      Parameter 1: Fan Speed
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Set Humidity Target [SET_HUM]
      Parameter 1: Humidity
        Range 20 to 80 Unit % (step of 1 and precision of 0).
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [REPORT_TEMP]
    Report Humidity [REPORT_HUM]

USER QUERY:
I want to increase the fan speed to high and set the humidity target to 45 percent.

The device supports setting fan speed and humidity target via commands SET_FAN and SET_HUM respectively. Fan Speed can be Low (1), Medium (2), or High (3), so High corresponds to 3. Humidity target must be between 20 and 80 percent, and 45% is valid.

Steps:
1. Use SET_FAN with parameter High (3) to increase fan speed.
2. Use SET_HUM with parameter 45% to set humidity target.

Result: Execute SET_FAN with High and SET_HUM with 45% to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    Set Color Temperature [CLITEMP]
      Parameter 1: Color Temperature
        Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Brightness [SET_BRI]
      Parameter 1: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Hue [SET_HUE]
      Parameter 1: Hue
        Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Saturation [SET_SAT]
      Parameter 1: Saturation
        Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the light and set the color temperature to 4500 Kelvin with brightness level 200.

The device accepts the On command (DON) to power on the light. It also supports setting color temperature via CLITEMP with a parameter from 2000 to 6500 Kelvin, and brightness via SET_BRI with a level from 1 to 254.

Steps:
1. Send the On command to turn on the light.
2. Use CLITEMP with parameter 4500 K to set the color temperature.
3. Use SET_BRI with parameter 200 to set brightness.

Result: Execute DON, then CLITEMP(4500 K), and SET_BRI(200) to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Off [DOF]
    Dim [DIM]
    Set Hue [SET_HUE]
      Parameter 1: Hue
        Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Saturation [SET_SAT]
      Parameter 1: Saturation
        Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Brightness [SET_BRI]
      Parameter 1: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
  ***Send Commands***
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Can you dim the light to brightness level 100 and set the hue to 30000?

The device supports the Dim command (DIM) to reduce brightness, but it does not specify a parameter for DIM, so it likely dims by a preset amount. To set brightness precisely, the device accepts SET_BRI with a brightness level from 1 to 254. The user wants brightness level 100, so SET_BRI is appropriate.

Additionally, the device accepts SET_HUE with a hue parameter from 0 to 65535; 30000 is valid.

Steps:
1. Use SET_BRI with 100 to set brightness exactly.
2. Use SET_HUE with 30000 to set the hue.

Result: Execute SET_BRI(100) and SET_HUE(30000) to meet the user's request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Saturation [SET_SAT]
      Parameter 1: Saturation
        Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Color Temperature [CLITEMP]
      Parameter 1: Color Temperature
        Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Set Brightness [SET_BRI]
      Parameter 1: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Off [DOF]
  ***Send Commands***
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Please turn off the light and set the saturation to 150.

The device accepts the Off command (DOF) to turn off the light. It also supports setting saturation via SET_SAT with a parameter from 0 to 254; 150 is valid.

However, turning off the light will likely override color settings, but the user requested both actions.

Steps:
1. Send DOF to turn off the light.
2. Use SET_SAT with 150 to set saturation.

Result: Execute DOF to turn off the light and SET_SAT(150) to set saturation as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set HSB Color [SET_HSB]
      Parameter 1: Hue
        Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 2: Saturation
        Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 3: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 4: Transition Time
        Range 0 to 540000 Unit millisecond (step of 100 and precision of 1).
    On [DON]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the light and set the hue to 50000, saturation to 200, brightness to 180 with a smooth transition over 5 seconds.

The device supports the On command (DON) to power on the light. It also accepts the SET_HSB command with parameters for Hue (0-65535), Saturation (0-254), Brightness (1-254), and Transition Time (0-540000 ms). The user wants a transition over 5 seconds, which is 5000 milliseconds.

Steps:
1. Send DON to turn on the light.
2. Use SET_HSB with Hue=50000, Saturation=200, Brightness=180, and Transition Time=5000 ms.

Result: Execute DON, then SET_HSB(50000, 200, 180, 5000) to fulfill the request with a smooth 5-second transition.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Alert [SET_ALERT]
      Parameter 1: Alert
        Enum
          None [1]
          Breathe [2]
          Long Breathe [3]
    Set Effect [SET_EFFECT]
      Parameter 1: Effect
        Enum
          None [1]
          Colorloop [2]
    Off [DOF]
  ***Send Commands***
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Can you make the light do a long breathe alert and then start a color loop effect?

The device supports the SET_ALERT command with options None (1), Breathe (2), and Long Breathe (3). It also supports SET_EFFECT with None (1) and Colorloop (2).

Steps:
1. Use SET_ALERT with Long Breathe (3) to initiate the alert.
2. Use SET_EFFECT with Colorloop (2) to start the color loop effect.

Result: Execute SET_ALERT(Long Breathe) followed by SET_EFFECT(Colorloop) to perform the requested actions.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set RGB Color [SET_COLOR_RGB]
      Parameter 1: Red
        Range 0 to 255 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 2: Green
        Range 0 to 255 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 3: Blue
        Range 0 to 255 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 4: Transition Time
        Range 0 to 540000 Unit millisecond (step of 100 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 5: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    On [DON]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the light and set the color to RGB values red=120, green=200, blue=150 with brightness 220 over 3 seconds.

The device accepts the On command (DON) to power on the light. It also supports SET_COLOR_RGB with parameters Red (0-255), Green (0-255), Blue (0-255), Transition Time (0-540000 ms), and Brightness (1-254).

The user wants red=120, green=200, blue=150, brightness=220, and a transition time of 3 seconds (3000 ms).

Steps:
1. Send DON to turn on the light.
2. Use SET_COLOR_RGB with parameters (120, 200, 150, 3000, 220).

Result: Execute DON, then SET_COLOR_RGB(120, 200, 150, 3000, 220) to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2000 to 6500 Unit Kelvin (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Brightness
      Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Reachable
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set XY Color [SET_COLOR_XY]
      Parameter 1: X
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Raw
      Parameter 2: Y
        Range 0 to 1 Unit Raw
      Parameter 3: Transition Time
        Range 0 to 540000 Unit millisecond (step of 100 and precision of 1).
      Parameter 4: Brightness
        Range 1 to 254 Unit Level (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Off [DOF]
  ***Send Commands***
    Off [DOF]

USER QUERY:
Switch off the light and set the color using XY coordinates X=0.35, Y=0.45 with brightness 180 over 2 seconds.

The device accepts the Off command (DOF) to turn off the light. It also supports SET_COLOR_XY with parameters X (0-1), Y (0-1), Transition Time (0-540000 ms), and Brightness (1-254).

The user wants to turn off the light and set color XY to X=0.35, Y=0.45, brightness=180, with a 2-second (2000 ms) transition.

Turning off the light will likely override color settings, but the user requested both.

Steps:
1. Send DOF to turn off the light.
2. Use SET_COLOR_XY with parameters X=0.35, Y=0.45, Transition Time=2000 ms, Brightness=180.

Result: Execute DOF, then SET_COLOR_XY(0.35, 0.45, 2000, 180) as requested.
